intro: Ammi petroselinoides, commonly known as cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its seeds are small, dry, and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. The plant is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
